goal.core.kr.language

Interface Var

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Expression, IParsedObject, Term

    public interface Var
extends Term
    Interface to represent variables that may occur in queries, action parameters, etc. in GOAL programs. Allows setup where GOAL interpreter abstracts from particular kr language used to represent concrete variables.
    Author:
    K.Hindriks

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Term applySubst(Substitution pSubst)
      Instantiates (or renames) any free variables that are bound by substitution by applying substitution.

      Returns a substitution that binds term to this Var.

      Checks if this variable is an anonymous variable.

    • Method Detail

      • renameVar

        Substitution renameVar(java.lang.String prefix,
                     java.lang.String postfix)

        Renames this Var into another variable, represented as a Term. The original label remains, but something is prefixed and/or appended to the original label.

        TODO: need this to STANDARDIZE APART variables in a context...

        In Prolog there is the "anonymous variable" '_' that should not be renamed, because all renaming of this variable would change it into a non-anonymous variable. It is up to renameVar to handle such special cases. See TRAC #1151.

        Parameters:
        prefix - The string to prefix to the original label
        postfix - The string to append to the original label
        Returns:
        a variant that can be used to rename the variable (should be a variable again, but represented as a term as this is needed in substitution; see GOALProgram.java and Macro.java where this method is called).

      • assign

        Substitution assign(Term term)
        Returns a substitution that binds term to this Var.
        Parameters:
        term - The term.
        Returns:
        The substitution with the term.

      • isAnonymous

        boolean isAnonymous()
        Checks if this variable is an anonymous variable.
        Returns:
        true if this Var is anonymous.
